title: Ticket #3243: Support running on older versions of Mac OS X
description:
Running a program on an older series of Mac OS X than it was built on may not work unless explicitly requested at build time.

I had to make two changes so that code built on Mountain Lion (10.8.x) would work on Lion (10.7.x):

  • Set environment variable MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET to the oldest series we want to support.
  • In the Globus libraries, don't access environ directly, as that doesn't always work in a shared library. Use _NSGetEnviron() instead.

This issue was report to the Globus Team: http://jira.globus.org/browse/GT-288

2012-Nov-02 16:39   Check-in [33974]: Build libltdl on Mac so that we can run on all recent versions. #3243 Globus depends on libltdl, which is available on some versions of Mac OS X. Condor binaries built on Mac OS X 10.7 using the OS's libltdl don't run on 10.6 (different version of libltdl) or 10.8 (no libltdl). So always build our own [...] (By Jaime Frey )
2012-Oct-10 16:57   Check-in [33648]: Proper fix for running on older versions of Mac OS X. #3243 It appears setting an environment variable in a cmake file doesn't cause it to be set when performing a build. So we have to set it in the environment before invoking cmake or make. (By Jaime Frey )
2012-Oct-02 11:37   Check-in [33554]: Fix access to environ in the Globus libraries on the Mac. #3243 On Mac OS X, shared libraries may not have direct access to the globus variable 'environ'. They can use _NSGetEnviron() to access it indirectly. The globus_common library does access environ. This breaks when a binary built on Mountain Lion [...] (By Jaime Frey )
2012-Oct-02 11:35   Check-in [33553]: Explicitly support Mac OS X 10.6 (Snow Leopard) and later. #3243 On the Mac, MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET to say that the binaries should be able to run on 10.6.x (Snow Leopard) and beyond. Otherwise, binaries built on 10.8.x (Mountain Lion) won't run on older series. (By Jaime Frey )
